snippet: President François Hollande will have to find $12.6 billion in cuts or revenue in 2012 and as much as $41.5 billion next year, an auditing agency reported.
abstract: President Francois Hollande will have to find $12.6 billion in spending cuts or new revenue in 2012 and as much as $41.5 billion next year to meet promised budget targets according to a report by an independent French agency; growth is predicted to be only 0.4 percent this year and 1 percent the next.
lead_paragraph: President François Hollande will have to find $12.6 billion in cuts or revenue in 2012 and as much as $41.5 billion next year, an auditing agency reported.

headline.seo: France Faces Stiff Budget Cuts to Meet European Deficit Target
headline.main: France Faces Budget Cuts to Meet European Target
headline.print_headline: France Faces Tough Choices To Cut Deficit
